name: Aguachile de Camarón
description: Fresh shrimp marinated in lime juice, cilantro, and serrano peppers, served with sliced cucumber and red onion.

name: Tostadas de Ceviche
description: Crispy corn tortillas topped with marinated fish or shrimp ceviche, avocado, and salsa.

name: Tamales de Elote
description: Steamed corn masa filled with shredded chicken, wrapped in corn husks and served with salsa verde.

name: Pescado Zarandeado
description: Grilled whole fish marinated in adobo sauce, typically served with rice, beans, and tortillas.

name: Carne Asada
description: Grilled marinated beef served with grilled onions, nopales (cactus), and salsa.

name: Pastel de Tres Leches
description: Moist sponge cake soaked in three types of milk (evaporated milk, condensed milk, and heavy cream), topped with whipped cream and fresh fruit.

name: Cocadas
description: Coconut candies made with shredded coconut, sugar, and condensed milk, typically served in bite-sized portions.

name: Margarita Sinaloense
description: A regional variation of the classic margarita made with tequila, lime juice, agave nectar, and a splash of orange liqueur.

name: Horchata
description: Sweet rice milk flavored with cinnamon and vanilla, served over ice.

name: Agua Fresca de Jamaica
description: Refreshing hibiscus flower drink sweetened with sugar and served cold.

name: Ceviche de Pescado
description: Fresh fish marinated in lime juice, onions, tomatoes, and cilantro, served with avocado slices.

name: Tacos de Camarón
description: Grilled shrimp served on warm corn tortillas with cabbage slaw, chipotle mayo, and salsa.

name: Sopa de Mariscos
description: Hearty seafood soup with shrimp, fish, octopus, and crab in a tomato-based broth, served with lime and cilantro.

name: Enchiladas Sinaloenses
description: Corn tortillas filled with seasoned shredded chicken, topped with red or green sauce, melted cheese, and crema.

name: Flan de Coco
description: Creamy coconut-flavored caramel custard, served chilled and garnished with toasted coconut flakes.

name: Churros
description: Deep-fried dough pastry sprinkled with cinnamon sugar, served with chocolate dipping sauce.

name: Paloma Sinaloense
description: A refreshing cocktail made with tequila, grapefruit soda, lime juice, and a pinch of salt, served over ice.

name: Tamarindo
description: Sweet and tangy tamarind-flavored agua fresca, served cold.

name: Michelada Sinaloense
description: A spicy beer cocktail made with Mexican lager, lime juice, hot sauce, Worcestershire sauce, and Tajín seasoning, served in a salt-rimmed glass.

name: Sopes de Chorizo
description: Thick corn masa cakes topped with spicy Mexican chorizo, refried beans, shredded lettuce, cheese, and salsa.

name: Pulpo a la Mexicana
description: Tender octopus marinated in a tomato-based sauce with onions, peppers, and spices, grilled to perfection and served with rice and tortillas.
